Instrument.name: Energetic Particle Composition Instrument for ULY
Instrument.description: The EPAC sensor measures ion fluxes, angular distributions, energy spectra, and composition across energies from 300 keV/nucleon to 25 MeV/nucleon. It produces 12 data classes, categorizing events based on (dE/dx) signals. The instrument resolves data for four ion groups (He, C-N-O, S-group, F-group) across eight energy channels. Proton detection is done through eight channels, with differentiation based on energy levels. Additional channels are configured for electrons and heavy ions, featuring specific thresholds and data acquisition intervals. The solar aspect angle varies throughout the mission, influencing data readings from sunlight exposure. Background rates and geometrical factors for detectors are also reported.
